data.title: upcoming guest roles on TV
data.text:
Posts: 18,000

Threads: 2,450

Joined: Feb 2003

Note: I've combined a number of individual one-post threads on Gina's many recent guest appearances on tv shows. They include:

- 2 eps of Law & Order, "Skin Deep" in '92 and "Purple Heart" in '95

- NYPD Blue in 1995, as "Dominican Woman" in "E.R."

- Profiler in '97, as Michelle Brubaker in "FTX: Field Training Exercise"

- La Femme Nikita in '98, as Jenna Vogler in "Open Heart"

- her many appearances on Herc, Xena and Cleo in from '97 thru '01

- a recurring role on Alias as Anna Espinosa, starting in '01, and going up to '06

- her series Firefly in '02

- The Agency in '03, (see below)

- 5 eps of Angel in '03

- 2 eps of The Guardian in '03 as Sadie Harper

- an ep of CSI in '04 as Warden Hutton

- 7 eps of the 3rd season of 24, as Julia Milliken

- a recurring voice role as Vixen in the animated Justice League, from '04 to '06

- 3 eps of The Shield in '06 as Sadie

- Without a Trace in '06 as Tyra Hughes, in "More Than This"

- her short-lived series Standoff in '06-'07, as Cheryl Carrera

- 2 eps of Dirty Sexy Money as Princess Ama

- Boston Legal in '08 as A.D.A. Mary Franklin in "The Gods Must Be Crazy"

- Eli Stone in '08, as "Emily's Attorney" in "Grace"

- Bones in '08, as Dr. Toni Ezralow in "The Bone That Blew"

- Criminal Minds in '08

- The Unit in '09

.........................

Full article on Gina in "The Agency" at:

http://tv.zap2it.com/news/tvnewsdaily.html?30077

On her character:

"She's complicated," Torres says of Dacia. "Here is a woman who fell in

love with a Marine during a time in her country when there was great

upheaval. They had every intention of going back to the States and having a life together, and chance ensued. She got left behind."

"Then you pick up five years later where everything is changed. You

don't know who's holding what cards, and who's going to play what."

This is Torres' first acting gig since the cancellation of her freshman

FOX series "Firefly," in which she played the first officer of a

cargo-hauling spaceship 500 years in the future. The series premiered to high hopes last fall but failed to survive into the new year.

"I feel like I've licked my wounds a little bit and moved on," she says.

"When you're cancelled, and you're involved in a show that you love so

much, and the rug gets pulled out from under you, it sucks the hope out of you a little bit. You've got to get back up onto that horse, and this audition was the horse. I booked it and said, 'OK, I can still ride.'"

That doesn't mean all is lost for "Firefly." "There's cooking

happening," Torres says, "and that's great, the fact that they still believe in it. They're trying to work something out."

Although Torres recently wed "Matrix" and "Biker Boyz" star Laurence

Fishburne, she hasn't forgotten her "Firefly" co-stars, including screen

husband Alan Tudyk. "Last week, I was making myself lunch, and I looked

over at Laurence, and I went, " I love you, but I miss my boys.'"

MORE GINA NEWS!

Gina Torres Signed For Three Episodes On Angel

Gina Torres who starred in "Firefly" earlier this season and appears on "The Agency" Saturday (Feb. 15), has signed to do three episodes of "Angel," according to The Hollywood Reporter. Her character is described as a "godlike" being who's been the guiding hand behind recent events on the show.

And again, I say...Fast Track!

Snippets from an article at Zap2it.com:

Fresh off her return engagement to writer/producer/director Joss Whedon's futuristic Western world in "Serenity," the upcoming film version of his short-lived FOX science-fiction series "Firefly," Gina Torres is getting together with a few more old friends when she reprises the role of K-Directorate agent Anna Espinosa in two episodes of ABC's "Alias."

Anna was last seen in season one, having one of her many battles with secret agent Sydney Bristow (Jennifer Garner). With the show now in its fourth season, where's Anna been all this time?

"She was presumed dead," Torres says. "It's almost a guarantee they'll bring you back. You never see me die. I just sort of disappear into the night. I think their way of explaining it was, they have a conversation, trying to bring everybody up to speed, and they said, 'I thought she was dead.'"

....Torres' episodes are "Echoes," airing Wednesday, Feb. 23, and "A Man of His Word," airing Wednesday, March 2 (9 p.m. ET, both nights).

Durn - my cable isn't picking up F/X right now, although it normally does.

She seems to have played this character - named Sadie Kavanaugh - in at least one other ep, the appropriately titled "Kavanaugh," which aired February 28, 2006. Here's the schedule:

February 28, 2006: Kavanaugh

March 7, 2006: Smoked

March 14, 2006: Of Mice and Lem - I think she may have been in this one too.

March 21, 2006: Postpartum

But as above - these seem to be rerun a good bit.

Vague Ren Pics connections... Kevin Sorbo guested one time on star Michael Chiklis's old series "The Commish." Chiklis went on to play Curly in the tv bio movie about the 3 Stooges, which co-starred Marton Csokas (Sarge's old lover on "No Thanks," many other roles.) And...Michael Chiklis is a Lesbian!

He is. He's Greek. Family is from the island of Lesbos. :laugh:

He's also in Sam and Rob's upcoming film "Rise," with Lucy Liu.
